data.text:
ğŸ¤” The Food2030 Networks Conference: Do incremental innovations delay progress to more systemic innovations that lead to fundamental change, or can the sum of many small incremental innovations build up to a larger systemic innovation? ğŸ’¡ For FUSILLI, focusing on the 'transformation of the urban food system', this is an important question. When looking at all the individual activities we carry out in our Living Labs, they seem small. However, representing FUSILLI as a whole, these incremental changes are enough to make a shift in the small scope that make it easier to move the 'larger mountains' in food systems in the EU-wide context. "There is a need for purposeful data sharing rather than sharing for the sake of sharing without knowing who will use it." - was a particularly interesting insights coming from the session "Innovation, Data, Digital Tools, and Sustainability Assessment". By sharing data with purpose, we can make sure that valuable data doesnt become lost in the crowd, and are user-friendly enough to be used in practice. Read further for more insights gained from the conference ğŸ‘‰ https://lnkd.in/e_fsvxG5 A nod of appreciation to FUSILLI partners present at the conference: Julia Pinedo Gil, Diego Fallah, Danielle Wilde, Elisabetta Luzzi, Lucia HÃ¶rner, Nina Isabella Moeller, Patricia Hernandez Lelli, and Oya TabanoÄŸlu! #FOOD2030 #sustainablefood #foodinnovation #foodsystems

ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º ğŸ“Š FoodTech looks really different in leading European ecosystems! We used DigitalFoodLab's database of European FoodTech deals to compare where the money was going for Europe's five leading ecosystems for 2023 and the first half of 2023. As you can see, they are super diverse, without a lot in common between them. 1 - The UK, France, and Germany have very diverse ecosystems: each with a leading category and a couple of followers: - The UK: food science, and more specifically brands (from pet food to beverages) is leading with more than half of the total funding. - Germany: delivery remains strong (it seems that quick-commerce deals are still a thing). - France: AgTech, notably animal feed (insects) with strong foodservice and supply chain chain categories. 2 - The Netherlands have an ecosystem highly concentrated on Delivery (and a single unicorn, Picnic) and on AgTech (more diverse). 3 - Switzerland: the country appeared on the radars last year due to a single huge deal ($325M) in Atlas Agro, a bioinputs (AgBiotech). Beyond that, the ecosystem is quite small, and wouldnâ€™t be here. ğŸ‘‰ If you want to access to the full report on the state of the European ecosystem (70+ pages full of insights and data, ask for the link in the comments) #graphs #foodtech #agtech #europe

Thrilled to share some highlights from my incredible time at the #FutureFoodTech Conference in Chicago! ğŸŒğŸš€ 1. Innovative Conversations: Had the opportunity to engage with some truly innovative companies making strides in the food tech sector. Their creativity and passion are paving the way for a sustainable future! ğŸŒ±ğŸ¤ 2. Consumer Acceptance: We dove deep into discussions about consumer acceptance, exploring what it takes to bring new tech from the lab to the table. Understanding consumer needs is key! ğŸ½ï¸ğŸ’¡ 3. Cultivated Meat Commercialization: Tackled the vital conversations around the challenges and opportunities in expediting the commercialization of cultivated meat. ğŸ¥© 4. Navigating Product Claims: I had the privilege of leading a roundtable on the complexities of complying with, verifying, and supporting new product claims. A crucial discussion for ensuring trust and transparency in our industry. ğŸ“‘âœ… 5. Endless Networking: Engaged in countless conversations throughout the conference, each adding valuable insights and fostering collaborative opportunities. ğŸ—£ï¸ğŸ¤— Thank you to all who joined and contributed to the discussions. ğŸ—“ Did you know that the 29 September is a special day for FOODRUS #H2020 Project â‰ ğŸ”” It is an important date because today is the International Day of Awareness of Food Loss and Waste, that seeks to promote awareness and collective action to reduce food loss and waste. ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º The European Commission set up ambitious goals by 2030 to reduce food losses by 10% when processing and manufacturing and by 30% per capita and food services, restaurants and households. ğŸ¯ To contribute to achieve these goals, the FOODRUS project is developing innovative solutions to help measuring and reducing FLW such as the The Food Loop App. This tool will show you the amount of ğŸ½ food wasted, the nutritional value, ğŸ‘£ the avoided carbon footprint and ğŸ’¦ the water saved! ğŸŒ¿ Meet Our Experts at the World Agri-Tech South America Summit! ğŸŒ¿ The 5th World Agri-Tech South America Summit, hosted by Rethink Events, is happening in SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil, on June 18-19. This event will bring together more than 700 delegates, 77% of whom are C-level executives, along with 80+ speakers, around 150 agri-food corporates, 120+ investors, and over 90 startups. ğŸ“… June 18-19, 2024 ğŸ“Œ Hotel Unique SÃ£o Paulo, Brazil Our team, Silvan Ziegler (Head of Market Americas) and Luis Fernando Quartarolis (Customer Success Officer Brazil), are set to participate and are excited to engage in conversations about Farm-to-Consumer #Traceability, Digital Farming Platforms, Climate-Smart #Agriculture, and Agri-Fintechâ€”some of the key themes of the event. They look forward to connecting with stakeholders across the agri-food ecosystem, including cooperatives, agribusinesses, food corporations, startups, investors, and government agencies. We're geared up for engaging discussions on: ğŸ” Assisting businesses in establishing traceability #FromSeedToTable by leveraging our #EUDR modular approach, which integrates our traceability platform with our #KoltiSkills or boots-on-the-ground extension service. ğŸŒ± Ensuring #sustainability throughout the #supplychain journey with our traceability platform, #KoltiTraceMIS. ğŸŒ³ Supporting businesses in detecting #deforestation and integrating data with local maps to ensure producer compliance through KoltiTrace MIS. ğŸ“Š Providing robust evidence for EUDR compliance submissions through our automated due diligence reports for processors and suppliers. ğŸ¤ Offering seamless support to enterprises needing third-party assistance in implementing sustainable sourcing efforts directly in producer communities via our extension service, which includes supply chain mapping, transactional traceability support, and risk mitigation services. ğŸ” Providing tailored solutions for enterprises to verify their supply chain data's completeness, quality, and EUDR compliance for thorough supply chain mapping review. Letâ€™s connect at the event!
